intro: Stachys araucana, commonly known as the Andean mint, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of South America. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountain meadows and rocky areas. Stachys araucana is valued for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
